shapes

Class ShapeBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.ShapeBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArbitrarySimplePolygon.RotationBuilder, Circle.Builder, Ellipse.Builder

    public abstract class ShapeBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A class which represents a builder for a Shape. The required Shape arguments of x, y, and color are provided, as well as the capability to inherit and add more arguments in the form of String keys.

    A ShapeBuilder allows for a more abstract version of Shape creation, by allowing the required arguments to be retrieved and passed to something like a UI without the program really needing to know exactly what the target Shape's constructors or creation involves. This is continued further when using ShapeFactory.

    In addition, Shape constructors which require some calculation to get all the required arguments can use a ShapeBuilder to calculate the arguments needed.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ShapeBuilder.Arg
      An immutable class to represent a ShapeBuilder argument.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Constructs a ShapeBuilder with the given target Shape name, variation name, and with the given required arguments in addition to the ones specified in this class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShapeBuilder

        public ShapeBuilder(java.lang.String targetShape,
                    java.lang.String variation,
                    java.util.LinkedHashSet<ShapeBuilder.Arg> args)
        Constructs a ShapeBuilder with the given target Shape name, variation name, and with the given required arguments in addition to the ones specified in this class.
        Parameters:
        targetShape - The name of the Shape to be built.
        variation - The name of the build variation to be used. See getVariation().
        args - The required args specified by subclasses to use when building the product, in addition to the arguments from this class.

    • Method Detail

      • mergeArgs

        protected static <T> java.util.LinkedHashSet<T> mergeArgs(java.util.LinkedHashSet<T> firstArgs,
                                                          java.util.LinkedHashSet<T> secondArgs)
        Creates a new LinkedHashSet with the keys contained in both set arguments.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the keys in the sets to merge.
        Parameters:
        firstArgs - The first LinkedHashSet containing keys to merge.
        secondArgs - The second LinkedHashSet containing keys to merge.
        Returns:
        LinkedhashSet, a new set containing the keys of both set arguments.

      • build

        public abstract Shape build()
        Creates a new instance of the target Shape using the arguments of this ShapeBuilder.
        Returns:
        Shape, a new instance of the target Shape using the arguments of this ShapeBuilder.

      • withArg

        public ShapeBuilder withArg(java.lang.String arg,
                            int value)
        Sets the argument with the given name on this builder to the given value. The argument must be declared already as a required argument, and it must be within the declared range. Otherwise, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        When possible, the statically typed versions such as withPosition(int, int) and withColour(int, int, int) should be used over this method, since those are checked on compile time.

        Parameters:
        arg - The name of the argument to set.
        value - The value to set for the argument.
        Returns:
        ShapeBuilder, this ShapeBuilder

      • withPosition

        public ShapeBuilder withPosition(int x,
                                 int y)
        Sets the x and y arguments on this ShapeBuilder to the given values.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the Shape to build.
        y - The y coordinate of the Shape to build.
        Returns:
        ShapeBuilder, this ShapeBuilder

      • getVariation

        public java.lang.String getVariation()
        Gets the String name of the build variation to be used by this ShapeBuilder when building. For example, a builder which uses angles versus a builder which uses lengths to build the same target shape could provide differentiating identification with this field.
        Returns:
        String, the name of the build variation to be used by this ShapeBuilder when building.

      • getArg

        public int getArg(java.lang.String arg)
        Gets the value of the argument on this builder with the given name. The argument must be declared already as a required argument, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        When possible, the statically typed versions such as getX() and getRed() should be used over this method, since those are checked on compile time.

        Parameters:
        arg - The name of the argument to get.
        Returns:
        int, the value of the argument with the given name.

      • getRequiredArgs

        public ReadOnlyIterator<ShapeBuilder.Arg> getRequiredArgs()
        Get an iterator of the ShapeBuilder.Args required to build a new Shape using this builder.
        Returns:
        ReadOnlyIterator, an iterator of ShapeBuilder.Args which specify the arguments required to build a new Shape.
